moves.11... f5 12. Re1 g6: Instead of taking the pawn, I give mine some cover...
moves.13. e5: ...but my opponent decides to push his...
moves.14... Ke8 15. Bg5 Be7: I do this to give my king more room to manoeuvre...
moves.17. d5 c6 18. dxc6 bxc6: I get another exchange here, giving me more space.
moves.20... Bb7: ...so I build a bridge with mine, protecting the c-pawn.
moves.21. a4 Rad8 22. f4 Rd6: I line up the stray pawn...
moves.31... Bc4 32. Bxc4 Rxc4: Now with no bishops left, it's down to the rooks...
moves.33. Rb3 d4: I go for a promotion attempt here.
moves.35... Ke5 36. Kg4: This move allowed my pawn to pull away...
moves.38. Rd3 Rd4 39. Rxd4 Kxd4: Was this the easy way out?
moves.40. Ke2 Ke5 41. Kxd2 Kxf5: I regain my one pawn advantage.
...but I deem it wise to give my right-hand pawns some space, to prevent any counter-promotion attempts.
moves.47. Kxh5 c5 48. Kg4 c4 49. Kf3 Kxa5: Now the game's mine to lose.
moves.50. Ke3 Kb4 51. Kd2 Kb3 52. Kc1 c3 53. K: Now the king can only move right or left.
moves.54... a5: ...this was the right move, so I'd still have two pawns.

gameName: No queens or knights... how will you do? III
